p: Field studies were conducted at four riverside sites around Bayreuth, Germany, also used in a previous study (Bieberich et al., 2020)⁠. Among them were two open sites comprised of abandoned meadows with tall herbaceous vegetation (Waischenfeld 49°49.98′N 11°20.17′E, Weidenberg 49°56.95′N 11°42.15′E) and two alder swamp forests, also with tall herbaceous vegetation (Ludwigschorgast 50°6.66′N 11°35.20′E, Neunkirchen 49°55.20′N 11°38.05′E). Each site consisted of a mosaic of patches with and without I. glandulifera.
